steps.step: UE in 5GMM-DEREGISTERED state sends a REGISTRATION REQUEST message to the AMF to initiate initial registration.
AMF may initiate 5GMM common procedures, such as identification, authentication, and security mode control, based on the information in the REGISTRATION REQUEST.
If the initial registration request is accepted, the AMF sends a REGISTRATION ACCEPT message to the UE. It assigns a TAI list to the UE.
Upon receipt of the REGISTRATION ACCEPT message, the UE enters the 5GMM-REGISTERED state and sets the 5GS update status to 5U1 UPDATED.
The UE sends a REGISTRATION COMPLETE message to the AMF to acknowledge the successful update of the network slicing information, if certain conditions are met.
steps.state_required: 5GMM-REGISTERED and certain information elements are present in REGISTRATION ACCEPT

steps.step: AMF stops timer T3550, set itself to 5GMM-REGISTERED after receiving REGISTRATION COMPLETE
